p.span: Virtual School is currently in session for all students. Virtual School will continue through June 12, which will be the last day of the school year for students.

Virtual School counts! You must participate in Virtual School to move on to the next grade or graduate at the end of the school year. If you need help connecting to your classes, or with anything else, please contact your Support Staff POC or complete the help form.
Click here for all information regarding Virtual School and our response to coronavirus.

span.span: Kingsman Academy is a public charter school providing
personalized, supportive education for 6-12 graders in Washington, D.C.

div.script: {"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Our Approach KAPCS","thumbnailUrl":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/dsjJJSGd5lo/mqdefault.jpg","image":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/dsjJJSGd5lo/mqdefault.jpg","height":270,"width":480,"embedUrl":"//www.youtube.com/embed/dsjJJSGd5lo","uploadDate":"2019-10-05T14:10:05.622224","description":"Learn about the educational philosophy of Kingsman Academy Public Charter School in Washington, DC.","duration":"PT1M33S","keywords":["People & Blogs","Kingsman Academy Public Charter School, MIddle school, High school, Charter school, Washington DC, Alternative school, Transfer school, credit recovery, Project based learning, Personalized learning"]}

p.span: We are an open-enrollment school that welcomes all students into a comfortable, therapeutic environment with personal attention and multi-tiered behavior and academic supports.
We have 5 innovative programs specially designed to meet our students' needs, all featuring small classes with project-based and experiential learning and a strong focus on success after high school.

div.script: {"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Academic Programs KAPCS","thumbnailUrl":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/eBd7d0ugEuQ/mqdefault.jpg","image":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/eBd7d0ugEuQ/mqdefault.jpg","height":270,"width":480,"embedUrl":"//www.youtube.com/embed/eBd7d0ugEuQ","uploadDate":"2019-10-05T14:33:08.265505","description":"Kingsman Academy in Washington, DC, has five different academic programs to fit our students' needs.","duration":"PT1M42S","keywords":["People & Blogs","Kingsman Academy Public Charter School, middle school, high school, Washington DC charter school, charter school, alternative school, transfer school, credit recovery, special education, project-based learning, personalized learning, therapeutic school"]}

{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Student Support Services KAPCS","thumbnailUrl":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/oYy2L-gbv54/mqdefault.jpg","image":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/oYy2L-gbv54/mqdefault.jpg","height":270,"width":480,"embedUrl":"//www.youtube.com/embed/oYy2L-gbv54","uploadDate":"2019-10-05T14:10:33.696030","description":"Kingsman Academy PCS in Washington, DC, has a variety of support programs to serve the needs of students and their families.","duration":"PT1M15S","keywords":["People & Blogs","Kingsman Academy Public Charter School, middle school, high school, Washington DC charter school, charter school, alternative school, transfer school, credit recovery, special education, project-based learning, personalized learning, therapeutic school, student support programs, community school, student support services"]}

p.span: Our staff supports students and families through all kinds of challenges, including food and housing difficulties, physical or mental health issues, trouble getting to school, and more.
Our talented staff supports students academically, behaviorally, and personally, building a community that students and their families can always count on.

div.script: {"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Students and Staff KAPCS","thumbnailUrl":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/CHRlKlCBFqQ/mqdefault.jpg","image":"//i.ytimg.com/vi/CHRlKlCBFqQ/mqdefault.jpg","height":270,"width":480,"embedUrl":"//www.youtube.com/embed/CHRlKlCBFqQ","uploadDate":"2019-10-05T14:34:25.174818","description":"A look at the heart of Kingsman Academy PCS: our people.","duration":"PT1M39S","keywords":["People & Blogs","Kingsman Academy Public Charter School, middle school, high school, Washington DC charter school, charter school, alternative school, transfer school, credit recovery, special education, project-based learning, personalized learning, therapeutic school"]}

div.p: Click here to apply to become a student at Kingsman Academy. Interested families for all grade levels should apply directly to Kingsman Academy.
Open positions for the 2020-2021 school year include:
Click here to read the latest edition of the Knightly News community newsletter. Read about competency-based education, our college and career program, and a profile of Ms. Foster!

p.span: All board meetings, including phone meetings, are open to the public, although the Board may enter into Executive Session to discuss confidential or sensitive matters. Contact Quineice Clarkson at (202) 547-1028 extension 384 for dial-in information.
Great! You are signed up for the email newsletter.

div.p: Sign up for our email newsletter to receive news and other important information about Kingsman Academy

p.span: Click here to see the DC Public Charter School Board (DC PCSB) school profile that includes school transparency documents for Kingsman Academy PCS.
We want to hear from our neighbors!
If you are a neighbor of the school and have questions, suggestions, or concerns, please reach out to our Community Liaison by email at community@kingsmanacadmy.org.
Students begin class at 9:30 each day.

span.span: © 2018 by Kingsman Academy Public Charter School

In accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (“Title VI”), Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 (“Title IX”), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (“Section 504”), Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (“ADA”), and the Age Discrimination Act of 1975 (“The Age Act”), Kingsman Academy Public Charter School does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in, its programs and activities. For additional information or to submit a complaint, please contact the Compliance Director by email, by mailing or delivering a written complaint to the school, or by calling (202) 547-1028.
